abstracts.cdata!:
The Saint Lucia Water Supply
            Infrastructure Improvement Project will support a short term
            investment program to carry out critical works, required to
            achieve the following objectives: a) alleviate the water
            shortage in the north of the country. The infrastructure
            works proposed will allow the utility to supply the entire
            north of the island with a more efficient, continuous and
            reliable service; b) implement urgent investments that will
            result in additional revenues, reduce the likelihood of
            commercial users (important sources of cross-subsidy for
            poor consumers) abandoning the system, and improve the
            potential of a successful partnership between the government
            and the private sector. The Infrastructure Improvement Works
            component includes the upgrade the Roseau dam pumping
            station; improvements to the raw water transmission between
            Vanard and Sarot; upgrade of the Theobalds water treatment
            plant; and, upgrade o f the Morne Bocage distribution
            pipeline. Due to the urgent nature of the works, and the
            close inter-relationship among the project components, it is
            considered that a turnkey contract will be the most
            efficient way to implement this type of project, and achieve
            success.  The second component - Technical Assistance and
            Project Management - includes the provision of technical
            assistance required to support Project implementation, carry
            out Project management activities, and strengthen the
            capacity of the Project Implementation Unit (PlU) staff in
            Project management, and priority technical areas, which may
            include the provision of training. The areas of technical
            assistance include: 1) oversight and monitoring of the
            quality of works; 2) studies on the water resources of the
            Roseau River, including analyses of a) the hydrological
            capacity of the Roseau dam and reservoir system, and
            possibly of other surface water sources, b) the potential
            for increasing the capacity of the Roseau dam through
            engineering improvements, and, c) safety and environmental
            considerations related to such activities; and,
            implementation of a groundwater resources study to determine
            the quantity, quality and potential use of groundwater in
            St. Lucia.
